techniques.name: Open Chord Strumming
techniques.description: Full cowboy chords played with relaxed southern rock rhythm

notes: Emphasize downbeats for southern rock feel
tips: Practice the D-C-G progression slowly first

techniques.name: Fingerpicking Intro
techniques.description: Classical fingerpicking pattern over the main chord progression

notes: Thumb plays bass notes on beats 1 and 3
tips: Keep fingernails short for clear tone

techniques.name: D Major Pentatonic Lead
techniques.description: Simple pentatonic phrases for guitar solos and fills

tips: Practice bends on B string 8th fret

sections.name: Intro
sections.description: Iconic fingerpicked introduction establishing the main progression
sections.vexTab:
options space=20 font-size=14
tabstave notation=true time=4/4
notes :q 2/4 3/3 2/2 | :q 0/5 1/3 0/2 | :q 3/6 0/3 0/2 | :q 2/4 3/3 2/2
notes: Creates rhythmic foundation for entire song

sections.name: Verse 1
sections.description: First verse with laid-back strumming over D-C-G progression

sections.name: Chorus
sections.description: Main chorus with fuller arrangement and vocal harmonies

sections.name: Guitar Solo
sections.description: Lead guitar solo using D major pentatonic scale
notes: Melodic phrases with southern rock character

sections.name: Outro
sections.description: Extended outro with vocal ad-libs over repeated progression
sections.progression: D - C - G - D (repeat to fade)

guitar.pickup: Humbucker or single-coil, neck position for warmth

amp.recommended: Marshall JTM45 or Fender Twin Reverb

beginner.title: Basic Chord Progression
skills: Open D, C, and G chord shapes

similarTechniques.title: Free Bird
similarTechniques.technique: D-C-G progression and southern rock style
similarTechniques.similarity: Same band, similar chord progression and techniques

similarTechniques.title: American Pie
similarTechniques.similarity: Similar fingerpicking approach and chord movement

similarTechniques.title: Dust in the Wind
similarTechniques.similarity: Similar fingerpicking technique and complexity level

similarTechniques.title: Blackbird
similarTechniques.similarity: Advanced fingerpicking technique and musical arrangement

commonMistakes: Rushing the tempo - song has a laid-back feel
Neglecting the bass line in fingerpicking
Playing lead parts too aggressively - maintain southern smoothness
practiceRoutine: Start with chord progression at slow tempo
Add treble notes gradually to fingerpicking
Work on D major pentatonic scale separately
Combine all elements at performance tempo
metronomeWork: Practice chord changes at 80 BPM first
Gradually increase to 98 BPM performance tempo
Practice lead scale runs with metronome

references.officialTab: Available in official Lynyrd Skynyrd songbooks
